title: Can we make Rylais an actual tanky/utility AP item?
body:
I remember back when Rylais used to be 500 health and 80 AP.

But now, especially after the MYMU it's become a staple item on almost any meta Mage due to it having 100 AP on top of a powerful passive.
I remember when mages rushed things like Morellonomicon, Ludens or just a Deathcap to boost their damage and NOT an item that's supposed to be a defensive option and help kiting/chasing.

I honestly feel Riot should tweak the stats a bit and not make it the go to rush item for BURST mages and the like.
It's supposed to be primarily a tank/utility AP item and building it as your first item shouldn't reward you with more damage than an actual offensive item.
Building it first should make your damage output take a hit, it shouldn't be a no brain-buy but rather an option, an investment, knowing that buying it might not help your damage a ton but give you utility and durability.

Hell, I'm totally fine with the slow passive as it's what a ton of champions are balanced around ({{champion:82}} {{champion:30}} {{champion:69}} and co.) but it shouldn't be the best offensive and the best defensive option in one item.
Hell, it's just like zhonyas ring back in the day.

I suggest changing up the stats a bit to mirror its previous iteration.

Hell making it similar to frozen mallet (60 Ap and 600 hp?) would be kinda funny too though I feel it would force it to become a niche item for a small pool of champs like Morde, Swain, Rumble, Vlad and co.


thoughts?

> [{quoted}](name=Malicious Metal,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=4OuxZu3m,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-09-04T00:35:34.057+0000)

> Please, the item didn't use to have a ton of AP in the first place.

It also wasn't ever bought in those days AND manaless mages (one of the groups who did actually buy it) lost spellvamp itemization since then.  

Now, I actually agree that purchasing a slow should be more situational than it is now, but I don't think nerfing is what's needed.  When RoA has the same amount of AP and 100 more HP for 500 gold less _with 400 mana and a decent passive to boot_, I find it hard to think manaless AP itemization needs nerfs.  I'd prefer to see Riot deter Rylai's rushes by making mana-users invest in mana items first (and not just 2 Doran's Rings).  (That or finally replace the mana regen on blue buff with something else so manaless champs don't get screwed over by it.)

And for what it's worth, I'd raise a similar argument to yours about the heal debuff on Morello - it's not as situational as I'd like and the item seems to be overperforming at the moment.

I started playing at the end of season V and realized just how strong it was when I bought it on Heimerdinger and began rushing it in a lot of games due to the fact that it gives increased zoning and powerful CC due to the turrets proccing on spell effects whilst making him tankier. The only reason I can imagine that people didn't just buy Rylai's before was either they didn't realize how strong it was or mages that would use it were unpopular.

OK, but how can you tell the difference between a case where Rylai's is actually OP and one where it's common only because the champs that use it well are popular?  For those people that would say the latter is a result of the former, then I'd explain the previous lack of Rylai's similarly - it wasn't good.  I don't even remember many mages building health pre-MYMU besides the obvious RoA users like Karthus/Ryze or Azir building Rylai's (but he's arguably the best Rylai's user in the game).  

I also think it's rare that an entire playerbase gets the strength of an item wrong (not to mention the professional scene), so we're going to have to agree to disagree there.  Maybe it's because alternative items were stronger at the time (Zhonya's still had 120 AP), but I don't think that means old Rylai's was good.

Wait, what? Void Staff is _incredibly_ powerful to the point where it's actually a _rushed_ item on burst champions that want to play risky. Its magic pen ( which includes _base_ magic resistance, unlike the Last Whisper variants ) usually more than makes up for the lower AP in comparison to other rush items _and_ amplifies all further AP purchases _and_ reduces the effectiveness of any attempts to itemize against your damage.

It's worth remembering that straight AP just increases the damage in accord with the AP ratios. Magic pen and AP together does that, but it also effectively increases the AP ratio and base damage of all your magic damage-dealing abilities. Haunting Guise can't really compare, because it has so much less AP and magic penetration that trails off as soon as anyone actually builds magic resist. Void Staff has none of these issues.

Also, I'm not really sure why you're comparing Morello's to Executioner's, unless AD champs are meant to have Executioner's as a first item option for aggressive sustain, solid damage, and overall improved combat abilities. 15 AD and a situational passive ain't doing any of that, unless there was a patch I missed that changed the ratio of autoattacks to 1000% AD and most AD-scaling abilities now scale with around 1450% of it.

Mortal Reminder is nothing like Void Staff or Morello's. It neither amplifies your damage indiscriminately like Void Staff ( because, y'know, bonus armor pen vs omni magic pen ), nor does it provide a huge chunk of AD and AS and a way to aggressively refuel your resources.

Which, yes, is Morello's purpose: more powerful spells more often without worrying about running out if you're successful at killing people. That Grievous Wounds effect? A nice little bonus that's mostly there for legacy reasons which would be utterly idiotic to buy the item for ( because, y'know, it triggers only as such low health totals ) and really only is still there because it does provide mages Grievous Wounds on an item they'd want anyway.

Lord Dominic's is the same deal, aside from the fact that Liandry's and Giant Slayer really do serve to amplify your damage against high-health targets. And, yes, Giant Slayer really is far superior.
I shed a silent tear every time I get Mortal Reminder because I know I'm missing out on the extra damage from Dominic's but I need to counter the enemy's healing _somehow_.

Make Rylai's Tank Again

In my opinion there's nothing wrong with the item at all. I personally cannot find any stats that shows the item as over powered or is too strong. Many meta mages do not build it right away, and while some do pick it up in the late game they are allowed to do so. Ahri, Xerath, Anivia, Syndra, Annie, Twisted Fate, and veigar to name a few do not build it as a staple item. It's an optional DEFENSIVE item in a toss up with Zhonya's due to it's active being so strong for waiting on cooldowns or outplays.

There are many champions that would rather opt for Zhonya's over Rylai since they are a burst mage. Annie flash ult combos? She needs that zhonyas to allow her team to continue their follow up and she doesn't die right away. Same with many champions that have to blow a combo and wait on cooldowns. It's no different from Malzahar, Viktor, Taliyah, or even Sol getting it so they can kite since their damage is sustained or requires them to get rather close. You have champions who also just have awesome synergy with the item, such as Brand.

So, in conclusion, I find that there is nothing wrong with the item. Many popular mages do not build it early and it is commonly not a first item. I've looked them up on a couple different sites, and to me it's just your word over what's actually being done. There's still a lot of diversity, and Rylai's is a last item or never even built on a lot of mages a majority of the time. Not to say it never happens.

Vel'koz builds it either last or around 3rd to 4th item, so he can kite late game. Syndra, lux, and Katarina do not build it. Those are all top performing and high win rate mid laners/mages.

I don't know who you are blindly believing, but there literally isn't any statistics pointing to the item being over powered or core on everybody. Core items are build first, second, and maybe third. Past there it's normally dependent upon the match. Cassiopeia, Viktor, Taliyah, or even Brand and Malz are not currently the highest winrate or highest performing mages. If you are basing anything off the LCS, it has a completely different sense of meta. They need mages who can either peel themselves, or make solid plays by themselves. Mages like Malzahar also allow them the ability to get picks and lockdown any one they need to.
